segment.source: This article discusses the use of certificates in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: This article discusses the use of certificates in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.
segment.target: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.

segment.source: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.
segment.target: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.

segment.source: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.
segment.target: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.

segment.source: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.
segment.target: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.

segment.source: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
segment.target: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.

segment.source: Shared certificate stores
segment.target: Shared certificate stores

segment.source: UWP apps use the new isolationist application model introduced in Windows 8.
segment.target: UWP apps use the new isolationist application model introduced in Windows 8.

segment.source: In this model, apps run in low-level operating system construct, called an app container, that prohibits the app from accessing resources or files outside of itself unless explicitly permitted to do so.
segment.target: In this model, apps run in low-level operating system construct, called an app container, that prohibits the app from accessing resources or files outside of itself unless explicitly permitted to do so.

segment.source: The following sections describe the implications this has on public key infrastructure (PKI).
segment.target: The following sections describe the implications this has on public key infrastructure (PKI).

segment.source: Certificate storage per app container
segment.target: Certificate storage per app container

segment.source: Certificates that are intended for use in a specific app container are stored in per user, per app container locations.
segment.target: Certificates that are intended for use in a specific app container are stored in per user, per app container locations.

segment.source: An app running in an app container has write access to only its own certificate storage.
segment.target: An app running in an app container has write access to only its own certificate storage.

segment.source: If the application adds certificates to any of its stores, these certificates cannot be read by other apps.
segment.target: If the application adds certificates to any of its stores, these certificates cannot be read by other apps.

segment.source: If an app is uninstalled, any certificates specific to it are also removed.
segment.target: If an app is uninstalled, any certificates specific to it are also removed.

segment.source: An app also has read access to local machine certificate stores other than the MY and REQUEST store.
segment.target: An app also has read access to local machine certificate stores other than the MY and REQUEST store.

segment.source: Cache
segment.target: Cache

segment.source: Each app container has an isolated cache in which it can store issuer certificates needed for validation, certificate revocation lists (CRL), and online certificate status protocol (OCSP) responses.
segment.target: Each app container has an isolated cache in which it can store issuer certificates needed for validation, certificate revocation lists (CRL), and online certificate status protocol (OCSP) responses.

segment.source: Shared certificates and keys
segment.target: Shared certificates and keys

segment.source: When a smart card is inserted into a reader, the certificates and keys contained on the card are propagated to the user MY store where they can be shared by any full-trust application the user is running.
segment.target: When a smart card is inserted into a reader, the certificates and keys contained on the card are propagated to the user MY store where they can be shared by any full-trust application the user is running.

segment.source: By default, however, app containers do not have access to the per user MY store.
segment.target: By default, however, app containers do not have access to the per user MY store.

segment.source: To address this issue and enable groups of principals to access groups of resources, the app container isolation model supports the capabilities concept.
segment.target: To address this issue and enable groups of principals to access groups of resources, the app container isolation model supports the capabilities concept.

segment.source: A capability allows an app container process to access a specific resource.
segment.target: A capability allows an app container process to access a specific resource.

segment.source: The sharedUserCertificates capability grants an app container read access to the certificates and keys contained in the user MY store and the Smart Card Trusted Roots store.
segment.target: The sharedUserCertificates capability grants an app container read access to the certificates and keys contained in the user MY store and the Smart Card Trusted Roots store.

segment.source: The capability does not grant read access to the user REQUEST store.
segment.target: The capability does not grant read access to the user REQUEST store.
